com.pump.image.transition

Class AbstractClippedTransition2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.transition.AbstractTransition
      • com.pump.image.transition.Transition2D
        • com.pump.image.transition.AbstractClippedTransition2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transition
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DotsTransition2D, GooTransition2D, SquareRainTransition2D, StarsTransition2D

    public abstract class AbstractClippedTransition2D
extends Transition2D
    This transition merges several shapes, and simply shows the incoming image as clipped through that collective area.

      • getShapes

        public abstract java.awt.Shape[] getShapes(float progress,
                                           java.awt.Dimension size)
        This returns a list of the shapes used to make the clipped area.
        Parameters:
        progress - the progress (from 0 to 1) of this transition
        size - the dimensions of the frame
        Returns:
        the shapes that make up the clipped area.

      • getStrokeWidth

        public abstract float getStrokeWidth(float progress,
                                     java.awt.Dimension size)
        An optional stroke width. This may be zero, but you might be surprised at the different a little stroke makes...
        Parameters:
        progress - the progress of the transition
        Returns:
        the width of the stroke

      • getInstructions

        public Transition2DInstruction[] getInstructions(float progress,
                                                 java.awt.Dimension size)
        Description copied from class: Transition2D
        This determines how to transition from A to B.
        Specified by:
        getInstructions in class Transition2D
        Parameters:
        progress - a float from [0,1]. When this is zero, these instructions should render the initial frame. When this is one, these instructions should render the final frame.
